Before everyone takes out trash, there are 50 units of trash in the house.
Emma wanted to take out 20 units of trash, and took out 10 units.

The conversation revolves around the monthly trash report in a building, with John expressing surprise at Jack's high trash output, Emma and Kate joking about their own trash intake, and Emma and Kate discussing their efforts to reduce their waste and make a positive impact on the environment.
conversation: Landlord

Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly trash report. John took out 17 units of trash. Kate took out 0 units of trash. Jack took out 14 units of trash. Emma took out 10 units of trash. Luke took out 9 units of trash.
John
Wow, I'm surprised Jack took out so many units of trash. Did you guys notice any changes in your daily habits that led to that?
Emma
Haha, yeah, I was surprised too. I mean, Jack's always been pretty conscious of his waste, but I guess he's really stepping it up this month. I'm just glad I didn't come in last place again... :p
Kate

Haha, yeah, I mean, I've been trying to reduce my trash intake too, but I think I might have to step it up if Jack's taking out 14 units :p. But seriously, I've been trying to be more mindful of my waste and make sure I'm not contributing too much to the problem. It's easy to get caught up in our daily routines and forget about the impact we're having on the environment.
Emma

Haha, yeah, I mean, I've been trying to reduce my trash intake too, but I think I might have to step it up if Jack's taking out 14 units :p. But seriously, I've been trying to be more mindful of my waste and make sure I'm not contributing too much to the problem. It's easy to get caught up in our daily routines and forget about the impact we're having on the environment. I've been trying to make small changes here and there, like using reusable bags and containers, and trying to avoid buying things that come in a lot of packaging. But I think we all have to do our part to make a real difference.
